name: GRÃœNFELD DEFENSE
uci_moves: d2d4 g8f6 c2c4 g7g6 b1c3 d7d5
idea: The ultimate hypermodern defense! Black lets White build an ideal pawn center with d4+e4+c4, then attacks it with pieces (...Bg7) and pawns (...c5, ...d5). The idea: the center is a target, not a strength! After ...d5 cxd5 Nxd5, Black trades the d-pawn for pressure against d4. Kasparov used it to become World Champion. Extremely theoretical but powerful!
errors_white: Overprotecting the center: the pawns become passive
Exchanging the dark-squared Bishop: it defends d4
Ignoring ...c5: this move attacks d4 directly
errors_black: Not playing ...c5: this is the key move to attack d4
Exchanging the Bg7: this Bishop is the soul of the defense
Being too passive: Black must attack the center actively
development: Strikes the center immediately - it's the difference from the King's Indian
g6 then Bg7 - the Bishop is a monster that targets d4 and a1
After cxd5 Nxd5, the Knight goes to c3 (Exchange) or b6 depending on variation
THE thematic move! Attacks d4 and opens the Bg7's diagonal
Nc6 puts pressure on d4 - natural development
Kingside castle after ...Bg7 - the King is well protected

traps.name: Center Trap
traps.desc: After 3...d5, if White plays 4.Nf3?! (instead of cxd5) ...dxc4! and Black keeps the pawn or gets good play. AVOID (White): Play 4.cxd5 Nxd5 5.e4 for the classical center.

traps.name: Exchange Trap
traps.desc: After 5.e4 if Black plays ...Nb6?! (instead of Nxc3) 6.Be3! and the Nb6 is misplaced, blocking the c-pawn. AVOID (Black): Play 5...Nxc3 6.bxc3 then ...Bg7 and ...c5.

traps.name: Russian Trap
traps.desc: Russian Variation: White plays d5 to close the Bg7's diagonal. But ...c6! opens everything and the Bishop becomes a monster again. AVOID (White): Only close with d5 if well prepared, otherwise the pawn becomes weak.

variants.name: Exchange Variation
variants.uci: d2d4 g8f6 c2c4 g7g6 b1c3 d7d5 c4d5 f6d5 e2e4 d5c3 b2c3 f8g7 g1f3 c7c5
variants.white_plan: Strong e4-d4 center but doubled c3 pawns. Play Be3, Rc1, Be2, 0-0 and look to attack with d5 or f4-f5.
variants.black_plan: Attack the center! ...Bg7, ...0-0, ...cxd4 cxd4 and the Bg7 dominates. ...Nc6, ...Qa5, ...Bg4 for pressure.

variants.name: Russian Variation
variants.uci: d2d4 g8f6 c2c4 g7g6 b1c3 d7d5 c4d5 f6d5 e2e4 d5c3 b2c3 f8g7 c1e3 c7c5 d1d2
variants.white_plan: Aggressive system! Qd2 prepares Bh6 (exchange the Bg7) and 0-0-0 with kingside attack. Rc1 and d5 possible.
variants.black_plan: Avoid exchanging the Bg7! ...0-0, ...cxd4 cxd4 ...Qa5 puts pressure. ...Nc6, ...Rd8 and central counterplay.

variants.name: Modern Variation
variants.uci: d2d4 g8f6 c2c4 g7g6 b1c3 d7d5 c4d5 f6d5 e2e4 d5c3 b2c3 f8g7 f1c4 c7c5 g1e2 b8c6
variants.white_plan: Bc4 targets f7 and d5. Ne2 avoids the ...Bg4 pin. 0-0, Be3 then d5 or f4 for the attack.
variants.black_plan: ...Nc6 attacks d4. After ...cxd4 cxd4 ...0-0, ...Bg4 (pins Ne2) or ...Na5 to chase the Bc4.
